excerpts.title: The Magic of Service Workers
excerpts.body:
They‚Äôre a thing. Google describes them as a ‚Äútechnical foundation‚Äù.
What I‚Äôve learnt is that a service worker is a JavaScript file. It runs in it‚Äôs own little world behind a website. That means it can‚Äôt access the DOM. What it can do is proxy network requests and access a storage cache.

I‚Äôve never had to deal with SSL certificates before. That‚Äôs always been someone else‚Äôs responsibility. Being ignorant of the technical details, the idea of setting up SSL/TLS wrong scares me. excerpts.title: React as a Static Site Generator
excerpts.body:
Two years ago I converted my website from WordPress to a static build process. It has served me well but the final process was rather messy. Hacks and plumbing to get Metalsmith plugins working my way didn‚Äôt helped.
Time for a new project!

excerpts.title: Working with Promises
My thoughts on React
excerpts.body:
I‚Äôve been playing with React for some time now. React is:
